chat.defaultResponse: I hear you. Let's work through this together. Can you tell me more about what's on your mind?

limit.weeklyReached: You've reached your weekly message limit. Please check back next week.
limit.rateLimited: You're sending messages too fast. Please try again later.

responses.default: I'm here to listen. Let it out.
responses.anxiety: I understand you're feeling anxious. That can be really challenging. Would you like to try a breathing exercise together, or would you prefer to talk about what's making you feel this way?
responses.sad: I'm sorry you're feeling sad. It's okay to feel this way, and I'm here to support you. Would you like to share what's been weighing on your mind?
responses.stress: I feel the weight of what you're carrying. Let's take this moment together.
responses.angry: Your anger is valid. This is your space to express it.
responses.lonely: I'm right here with you. You're not alone in this.
responses.scared: Fear can be overwhelming. I'm here to sit with you through it.
responses.work: Work stress is real. Remember to prioritize your mental health.
responses.mood: Tracking your mood is a great step! You can use the Mood tab to log how you're feeling. Would you like me to guide you through it?
responses.exercise: Great choice! We have various exercises including breathing techniques, mindfulness, and movement. Check out the Exercises tab, or I can recommend one based on how you're feeling.

helpCenter.title: Help Center
helpCenter.chatSupportDesc: Get instant help from our support team
helpCenter.chatGreeting: Hello! I'm here to help. What can I assist you with today?

mood.question: How do I track my mood?
mood.answer: Navigate to the Mood tab and tap on today's date. Select the emotion that best represents how you're feeling and optionally add notes about your day.

exercises.question: What are wellness exercises?
exercises.answer: Wellness exercises are guided activities designed to improve your mental health. They include breathing exercises, mindfulness practices, journaling prompts, and gentle movement activities.

privacy.question: Is my data private and secure?
privacy.answer: Yes, your data is encrypted and stored securely. We follow industry best practices for data protection and never share your personal information with third parties.

language.question: How do I change the app language?
language.answer: Go to your Profile tab, tap on Settings, and select Language. You can switch between English and Arabic at any time.

export.question: Can I export my mood data?
export.answer: Currently, you can view your mood history in the Analytics section. Export functionality is coming in a future update.

usage.question: How often should I use the app?
usage.answer: We recommend daily check-ins for mood tracking and completing at least one wellness exercise per day. However, use the app as much or as little as feels right for you.

crisisResources.title: Crisis Resources
crisisResources.callEmergency: If you're in immediate danger, please call 911 or your local emergency services.
crisisResources.seekHelp: If you or someone you know shows these signs, seek help immediately:
crisisResources.notAlone: You are not alone. Help is available, and recovery is possible. Reaching out for support is a sign of strength, not weakness.
crisisResources.confirmCall: Are you sure you want to call {{phoneNumber}}?

suicidePreventionLifeline.title: National Suicide Prevention Lifeline
suicidePreventionLifeline.description: Free, confidential 24/7 support for people in distress

crisisTextLine.title: Crisis Text Line
crisisTextLine.description: Text HOME to connect with a crisis counselor

samhsaHelpline.title: SAMHSA National Helpline
samhsaHelpline.description: Treatment referral and information service for mental health

veteransCrisisLine.title: Veterans Crisis Line
veteransCrisisLine.description: Support for Veterans and their families

warningSignsList: Talking about wanting to die or kill oneself
Looking for ways to kill oneself
Feeling hopeless or having no purpose
Feeling trapped or in unbearable pain
Talking about being a burden to others
Increasing use of alcohol or drugs
Showing rage or talking about seeking revenge
